page.title: 01HOW PENSBY HAS CHANGED
page.content: The population of Pensby has changed a lot over the years.More people have arrived so more houses have been built.It has grown from a few cottages and farms to a large residential area. To help us to find out how Pensby has changed over the past hundred years we spoke to some of the old folk from Barnston "Over 60's Club." In 1927 there were only fifty houses and two shops in Pensby: The 8 o'clock shop was a small post office selling coal, and the chip shop on the corner of Gills Lane used to be a general store, selling vegetables and groceries. There were usually six people living in a house with only candles for light and no gas or electricity.
